title: [Oracle SQL] Support OE-5-214 for Oracle SQL
body:
In this pr, I supported OE-5-214 referring to: https://docs.oracle.com/en/database/oracle/oracle-database/21/sqlrf/XMLSEQUENCE.html#GUID-BE0837A9-7D85-4621-8C22-1FECAD17E569
The following SQL can now be parsed:
``` SELECT VALUE(p) FROM warehouses w, TABLE(XMLSEQUENCE(EXTRACT(warehouse_spec, '/Warehouse/*'))) p WHERE w.warehouse_name = 'San Francisco'; ```
Related issue: https://github.com/apache/shardingsphere/issues/27569

The related issus is : https://github.com/apache/shardingsphere/issues/27569
The following SQL(OE-6-6) can now be parsed:
``` SELECT o.item.line_item_id, o.item.quantity FROM short_orders o; ```
Also, in this pr, I refactored some methods to avoid high complexity issue.

title: [Oracle SQL] Support parsing create type for Oracle
body:
In this PR, I referred to the Official guide of Oracle: https://docs.oracle.com/en/database/oracle/oracle-database/21/lnpls/CREATE-TYPE-statement.html#GUID-389D603D-FBD0-452A-8414-240BBBC57034 and supported parsing basic create type clause for Oracle. Since the Create Type clause is rather complex, this pr does not take all the branches of this clause into account.
Also, in this PR, I supported MultisetExpression in CastFunction as it is related to one of the cases in this issue: https://github.com/apache/shardingsphere/issues/27569
The related cases are OE-4-5, OE-5-17, OE-5-21, OE-5-186, OE-6-7, OE-8-2, SH-5-108.

title: [Oracle SQL] Support OE-4-6/OE-4-7/OE-4-8 of Oracle SQL
body:
In this pr, I supported parsing of the following SQLs:
``` SELECT customer_id, cust_address_ntab MULTISET EXCEPT DISTINCT cust_address2_ntab multiset_except FROM customers_demo ORDER BY customer_id;```

``` SELECT customer_id, cust_address_ntab MULTISET INTERSECT DISTINCT cust_address2_ntab multiset_intersect FROM customers_demo ORDER BY customer_id;```

```SELECT customer_id, cust_address_ntab MULTISET UNION cust_address2_ntab multiset_union FROM customers_demo ORDER BY customer_id;```
Reference could be found at: https://docs.oracle.com/cd/B13789_01/server.101/b10759/operators006.htm

title: Add default data type `VARCHAR(4000)` for encrypt columns.
body: Fixes #27587 Changes proposed in this pull request: - Add default data type `VARCHAR(4000)` for encrypt columns. ### Reference - In MySQL, the maximum length of varchar is variable, determined by the character set (greater than 10000) - https://dev.mysql.com/doc/refman/8.0/en/char.html - In PG, the maximum length of varchar is 10485760 - https://www.postgresql.org/docs/15/datatype-character.html - In Oracle, varchar has a maximum length of 4000 (VARCHAR data type is currently synonymous with VARCHAR2) - https://docs.oracle.com/en/database/oracle/oracle-database/21/sqlrf/Data-Types.html#GUID-7B72E154-677A-4342-A1EA-C74C1EA928E6 ### Test - MySQL - PG - Oracle --- Before committing this PR, I'm sure that I have checked the following options: - [x] My code follows the [code of conduct](https://shardingsphere.apache.org/community/en/involved/conduct/code/) of this project. - [x] I have self-reviewed the commit code. - [x] I have (or in comment I request) added corresponding labels for the pull request. - [x] I have passed maven check locally : `./mvnw clean install -B -T1C -Dmaven.javadoc.skip -Dmaven.jacoco.skip -e`. - [ ] I have made corresponding changes to the documentation. - [x] I have added corresponding unit tests for my changes.

title: [Oracle SQL] Support HR-7-1 of Oracle SQL
body: The following SQL can not be parsed because createCompareSegment deals with Subquery wrongly. ```SELECT * FROM employees WHERE salary = ANY (SELECT salary FROM employees WHERE department_id = 30) ORDER BY employee_id;``` I referred to the createCompareSegment method of MySQLStatementVisitor and fixed the createCompareSegment of OracleStatementVisitor.

title: [Oracle SQL] Support HR-5-158 of Oracle SQL
body:
For #27569.

In this pr, I added XMLAGG in the unreservedWord so that the alias xmlagg can be parsed correctly.
Now this SQL is supported:
``` SELECT SYS_XMLAGG(SYS_XMLGEN(last_name)) XMLAGG FROM employees WHERE last_name LIKE 'R%' ORDER BY xmlagg; ```
